column1: serbian_FEATURES;§Y*§! Unless this character follows the §YYugoslavist§! Religion
column2: they are more likely to start and join §Yindependence factions§! if liege is not of the same culture;;;;;;;;;x

column1: croatian_FEATURES;§Y*§! Unless this character follows the §YYugoslavist§! Religion
column2: they are more likely to start and join §Yindependence factions§! if liege is not of the same culture;;;;;;;;;x

column1: bosnian_FEATURES;§Y*§! Unless this character follows the §YYugoslavist§! Religion
column2: they are more likely to start and join §Yindependence factions§! if liege is not of the same culture;;;;;;;;;x

column1: slovenian_FEATURES;§Y*§! Unless this character follows the §YYugoslavist§! Religion
column2: they are more likely to start and join §Yindependence factions§! if liege is not of the same culture;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESCYUGO1;The Yugoslavist religion has always been an uncomfortable compromise
column2: intended to secure religious peace in the Balkans at last. At no point have many people actually believed in this syncretic admixture of Christianity and Islam
column3: but most people have been persuaded to go along with the charade. Recently
column4: however
column5: a zealous preacher has been drawing crowds of followers by preaching loudly that the Truth is more important than Peace
column6: and that we cannot simply blaspheme the Word of God
column7: even if doing so lessens the spilling of blood. [Root.GetTitledName] has condemned the man
column8: but few heed him. All eyes wait for the Emperor to intervene
column9: for it is his duty to support the Yugoslavist faith
column11: it is unlikely to weather this storm.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_yugoslav.1;I will throw my full weight behind [Root.GetTitledName]!;;;;;;;;;x

column2: so the Church should deal with it.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTC_yugoslav.1;The preacher is right - I've had enough of this charade too.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTE_yugoslav.1;Trouble in the Balkans? Does this really count as news?;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESCYUGO2;Now that you have decided to support the Propiciater against the rebels
column2: you should think about how precisely you intend to deal with this problem. The preacher and his associates are rapidly gaining followers
column3: and we must act quickly if we are to stem this tide.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_yugoslav.2;Ban his movement and arrest his followers!;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_yugoslav.2;Write and disseminate a theological treatise thoroughly refuting him;;;;;;;;;x

column2: this seems hard. Just give a token statement of support.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESCYUGO3;Your efforts have borne fruit - the preacher's followers have started to dry up
column2: and it seems that people are slowly coming around to your way of seeing things. While it will take many decades for peace to truly return
column3: all you have to do now is wait out the rebels.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_yugoslav.3;This is about as good as we could've hoped for.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESCYUGO4;Your attempts have been successful - in part. You have managed to stamp out the worst centres of the rebellion
column2: but they retain widespread popular support
column3: and your actions have alienated the commonfolk. It will be many years before this settles down
column4: and who knows what his followers might be inspired to do in the meantime?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESCYUGO5;Disaster! Your attempts to counteract the preacher have completely backfired
column2: and now his teachings are spreading all over the Empire! You'll have to hold on for dear life if you want to survive...;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_yugoslav.5;Why did we even start this stupid religion?;;;;;;;;;x

column2: At Last;;;;;;;;;x
you have the opportunity to rid yourself of the ghastly joke that is Yugoslavism. But what religion do you truly follow

column1: EVTOPTC_yugoslav.6;I follow the words of the Prophet;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESCYUGO8;Despite the challenges that it has faced
column2: the Yugoslavist faith has stood resolute
column3: never allowing the forces of sedition or rebellion to overwhelm it. By now
column4: the energies of the rebels have been exhausted
column5: and people have come to accept that the faith will not be gotten rid of. This represents a major shift
column6: as the people of the Balkans are now more or less content to let the Yugoslavist church rule over them
column7: at least in the public sphere. In addition
column9: groups of people who seem to sincerely believe in Yugoslavism have come forth
column10: and have established religious communities and making themselves part of Balkan life. Perhaps in the future
column11: Yugoslavism will no longer be treated as a joke?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESCYUGO9;Despite the challenges that it has faced
column2: the Yugoslavist faith has stood resolute. Despite the chaos that has consumed the Balkans
column3: it has maintained its hold over the core of the Empire
column4: and people are now willing to
column6: go back to pretending to believe in it publically.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESCYUGO10;It is finally over. The sham church established by the Yugoslavian Emperor is finished. Nobody attends its ceremonies
column2: instead flocking to Churches and Mosques. Nobody listens to [Root.GetTitledName]'s pronouncements
column3: and even the Empire itself is no longer formally Yugoslavist. Today
column4: [Root.GetTitledName]
column5: seeing the complete lack of relevance that Yugoslavism had to the Balkans
column6: formally laid down his symbols of office
column7: and resigned. Nobody appointed a successor.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTD_yugoslav.10;The Will of God is irresistable;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Yugoslavist religion has been greatly strengthened by the actions of wise and faithful rulers. The faith's power has grown so much that [Root.GetTitledName] has decided that they should direct their efforts outwards
column3: for the world is still filled with heathen darkness
column4: and the Yugoslavist faithful must bring the light to these benighted souls. This marks the beginning of a new era
column5: when Yugoslavists will go on Crusade.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTC_yugoslav.11;These ridiculous syncretists must be stopped!;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESCYUGO12;You have decided to take no action against the troublesome preachers. Whatever happens now is entirely out of your hands.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESCYUGO13;With the triumph of the Yugoslavist religion
column2: [From.GetTitledName] has ordered that all of his subjects should convert
column3: and give up their old faiths. No leeway is given in this matter - anyone who refuses to convert will be considered the enemy of the Crown.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: but I will keep my true faith in secret.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESCYUGO15;With the consolidation of the Yugoslavist faith
column2: monastic orders have been formed for the defense and propagation of the religion. One of these is a group of pious knights who have joined together for the defense of Yugoslavism against its many enemies. They refuse to fight other Yugoslavists
column3: and work tirelessly to defend the faithful from their many enemies.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_yugoslav.15;At last we have our own protectors.;;;;;;;;;x
balkaner_secret_religion_desc;Though I've been forced to follow the Yugoslavist absurdity in public
column2: behind closed doors
column3: the faith of my ancestors still calls to me.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: balkaner_abandon_jugo_desc;Now that the Emperor no longer forces his ridiculous religion on you
column2: you are finally free to return to the faith of your ancestors.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: strengthen_jugoslavism_desc;With the expansion of Yugoslavist lands and the strengthening of the faith
column2: a springtime of growth has come upon the Church. With your patronage
column3: the Yugoslavist religion can grow even larger
column4: founding monastic and knightly orders
column5: as well as start Crusades to spread the faith abroad.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTTOOLTIPVIOLENTYUGO;The successfulness of this strategy will depend on your §YIntrigue§! and §YMartial§! Stats.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTTOOLTIPREASONYUGO;The successfulness of this strategy will depend on your §YDiplomacy§! and §YLearning§! Stats.;;;;;;;;;x
tooltip_religion_feature_dynasty_bonus;§GFamily members think better of each other§!;;;;;;;;;x
tooltip_religion_feature_love_likely;Spouses more likely to fall in love;;;;;;;;;x
religion_pronatal_desc;There is nothing more sacred than the bond between man and wife
column2: or the bond between parents and children. As the gods form one harmonious family
column3: so should our families be peaceful
column4: plentiful

column1: scrapKey;Your team has returned with a handful of Old World scrap - the rusted out but still somewhat remarkable metallic building materials of the Ancients.;;;;;;;;;x
glassKey;Your team has returned with a piece of Old World glass. Though it is merely a fragment
column2: it is far clearer and stronger than anything modern smiths can reproduce.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: spectaclesKey;Your team has returned with a mangled tangle of metallic wire with two circular hoops on the front. Legends say that these machines helped the Ancients restore their sight
column2: but it's never been entirely clear how.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: chemicalKey;Your team has returned with a box full of chemicals and reagants from an Old World stockpile. Though you're not entirely sure how to make best use of them
column2: they'll surely be of some use.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: fragmentKey;Your team has returned with a few sheaves of paper from a disintegrated Old World text. If only you could decipher it
column2: what wisdom might be contained within?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: machineKey;Your team has returned with a piece of fantastic Old World machinery - though completely broken and defunct
column2: of course.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: does_not_hold_special_empire;Does not hold any special title;;;;;;;;;x
cslewis;Allows conversion to the Novelist religion\nIncreases conversion speed of Novelist provinces to your religion \n Increase conversion speed of provinces to Novelist;;;;;;;;;x
lion_witch_wardrobe;The Tale of the Lion and the Witch;;;;;;;;;x
lion_witch_wardrobe_desc;This ancient tome appears to be a lost Novelist tale. While some of its elements correspond to parts of The Novel
column2: it also contains many elements foreign to the sacred canon. Novelists are divided on whether this counts as a lost revelation or a devious heresy.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: lewis_conversion_desc;The Book that I carry with me tells such a fantastic and wonderful story. Is this really what the Novelists believe? Perhaps their religion is more noble than I had ever thought..?;;;;;;;;;x
guillotines_for_a_humane_society_desc;This book describes the secret teachings of the Jacobonist sect. Passed down from generation to generation
column2: only the Dictator Himself is supposed to read it.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: jacobinist_conversion_book;Accept the Ideals of the Revolutions;;;;;;;;;x
jacobinist_conversion_book_desc;The secret doctrine of the Jacobinists seethes through my mind. I am convinced it must be true! I must set to work at once.;;;;;;;;;x
the_jungle_book;The Trials of Rikki-Tikki-Tavi and The Gods of the Copybook Headings;;;;;;;;;x

column2: written by an ancient British holy man
column3: details the adventures of the British in India. Though not regarded as scriptural
column4: it is respected nearly as much as the canonical Thelemic texts.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: kipling_morality_book_desc;The tome that I possess enthralls me with its depiction of the ruin caused by immorality and the glory of virtue. I ought to study it more carefully
column2: so as to become a better person.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: the_divine_comedy_desc;Beloved for over a thousand years
column2: this work illustrates Christian theology by imagining the author's journey through Hell
column3: Purgatory
column4: and then Heaven.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: dante_morality_book_desc;The Divine Comedy contains many revealing descriptions of the punishment of sin and the reward of virtue. Perhaps a deep reading of it will inspire me to a higher moral life.;;;;;;;;;x
plato_desc;This massive collection of essays and Socratic dialogues contains the philosophy and thought of Plato
column2: one of the greatest philosophers of history
column3: believed by many Hellenics to have been a god.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: this recipe tells how to create medicines that can cure nearly any disease. Whoever rediscovered this is truly a great scholar
column3: worthy of becoming a Laureate themselves.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: take_penicillin_desc;The wondrous powers of the Panacea may well cure my disease - but it isn't guaranteed to work.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: spoken of in hushed and terrified whispers
column3: is the very tool of the Merchant of Death Himself. This recipe tells how to create that ancient and deadly reagant
column4: capable of blasting man and stone alike to tiny pieces with but a small flame.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: when ingested
column3: has the power to make a man nearly immune to pain
column4: and can increase his hardiness of body
column6: and shrewdness of judgment. Yet beware - every legend that mentions the Elixir inevitably ends with its user destroying himself through addiction.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: take_morphine_desc;The Elixir will give me power - I just need to be wary of the risks...;;;;;;;;;x
morphine_safety_timer_desc;If you take the Aelixir before this modifier expires
column2: there will be consequences...;;;;;;;;;x

column1: mystic_insight_desc;This is a vague notion that I can recall from my mystical experiences.;;;;;;;;;x
mystic_tome_desc;This is a compilation of mystical experiences
column2: written down on sheepskin and preserved for posterity.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: scrap_desc;The flotsam and jetsam of the Ancients. Much of this was at one point part of the buildings and engines of the Old World.;;;;;;;;;x
spectacles_desc;This device allows those with malfunctioning eyes to see more clearly.;;;;;;;;;x
glass_desc;A fragment of glass from the Old World. Though the art of glassblowing is still practised
column2: modern artisans cannot produce anything of equal quality
column3: clarity
column4: or durability.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: non-functional piece of Old World machinery. A subject of intense interest to scholars. If only it could be made to work again...;;;;;;;;;x

column1: repaired_machine_desc;Extensive effort has managed to get this machine to move again. Unfortunately
column2: it doesn't actually do anything useful. Oh well
column3: at least it's impressive!;;;;;;;;;x

column2: either collected from an Old World laboratory or created from natural ingredients following ancient recipes.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: manuscript_fragment_desc;A fragment from an Ancient tome. Piecing together enough of these might allow you to create something of value. If you're very lucky
column2: it might even be the original text of a single book!;;;;;;;;;x
written under mystical influence on paper painstakingly coated with expensive blue paint
column3: hold the plans to an Old World design or theorem of some kind. Probably.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: partial_manuscript_desc;The beginnings of a manuscript - a few scattered pages here and there. Perhaps several of these together could form a coherent whole?;;;;;;;;;x
totem_2_desc;A mish-mash of Old World gun fragments
column2: bullet casings
column3: and symbols of war. This mystic totem is believed to increase its bearer's prowess in the art of war.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: totem_1_desc;This mystic totem is created from Old World technology. The strange
column2: boxes with glass screens have always puzzled us
column3: but it is believed that they helped Ancient Man to speak well
column4: and it is also believed that this magic rubs off on the wielder of this totem.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: totem_3_desc;This mystic totem is created from the remains of an Old World adding device. It is widely believed that it helps the wearer do arithmetic in their head more quickly.;;;;;;;;;x
totem_4_desc;This mystic totem is created from Old World wreckage and detritus. It is believed to make the user wiser and more devious.;;;;;;;;;x
theorem_desc;This work describes a mystical conjecture
column2: created while under the effects of an otherworldly experience.;;;;;;;;;x
Book One;;;;;;;;;x
created while under direct inspiration from Nobel himself
column3: describes the invisible demons that cause disease and decay
column4: as well as the rituals capable of banishing them.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Book Two;;;;;;;;;x
created while under direct inspiration from Nobel himself
column3: describes the occult forces that lurk within the natural world
column4: who can be tapped into to gain nearly limitless power - though there is always a risk of them slipping their bonds and killing their summoners.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Book Three;;;;;;;;;x
created while under direct inspiration from Nobel himself
column3: tells of the secret spirits that create lightning
column4: as well as telling much of how the Ancients trapped them to light and power their civilisation.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: teapot_desc;What a beautiful example of ancient British artisanship. What did they use it for
column2: though?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: teacup_desc;This frail and elegant cup seems to be used by the British aristocracy for some drinking ritual or other.;;;;;;;;;x
teaset_desc;This beautiful and very expensive teaset is the envy of every noble family in the British Isles.;;;;;;;;;x
beer_recipe_fragment_desc;This scrap of paper contains a small piece of an ancient German recipe for a beer far superior to any that modern techniques can produce.;;;;;;;;;x
beer_recipe_desc;This ancient recipe allows you to create beer far superior to anything modern brewers are capable of. Guard it with your life.;;;;;;;;;x
artillery_book_fragment;Piece of an Ancient Ballistic Manual;;;;;;;;;x
artillery_book_fragment_desc;This is a small scrap of an ancient manual describing how to make siege engines and explosives.;;;;;;;;;x
artillery_book;On The Arte and Skill of Bomb-Making;;;;;;;;;x
artiller_book;This ancient manual explains in great detail how to create powerful bombs and siege engines. Unfortunately
column2: much of its advice is difficult to understand
column3: but at least some of it can be made use of.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: tesla_coil_piece_desc;This is a piece of a strange ancient machine whose purpose is unknowable.;;;;;;;;;x
tesla_coil_desc;This is an ancient machine capable of harnessing the power of lightning.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian1Desc;The secrets of the ancients are many and deep. Plumbing their mystic depths is very difficult even for the most dedicated scholar. Yet
column2: if I ever wish to be counted among the Laureates
column3: I must delve nonetheless.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_nobelian1;I will search for a mentor to help me.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC_nobelian1;My mentor will aid me on the difficult path.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian2Desc;The men I sent out to search for a mentor have returned with a skilled scholar-mystic. They ask for a substantial sum of gold in exchange for serving me.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian3Desc;My men have returned with a skilled scholar and mystic. They've agreed to serve me
column2: but only on the condition that I "promise to give them whatever they desire
column3: without exception" at an unspecified future date.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_nobelian3;What's the worst that could happen?;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian4Desc;My search party has returned with a skilled scholar-mystic. However
column2: the price they are asking is…rather extreme. They seem to demand a piece of my own flesh to serve me.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_nobelian4;If this is the price of immortal wisdom...;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_nobelian4;Get away from me and my family. In fact
column2: exile this freak!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian5Desc;I will delve into the mysteries of the [Root.GetReligion] religion
column2: and bring wisdom back from the Old World to the benighted modern man. As I enter the sacred sauna
column3: the attendants prepare the special herbs
column4: as I prepare to divine the Will of Nobel.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_nobelian5;A Master like me can be assured of success.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: but success is never certain.;;;;;;;;;x
as ideas flow into your mind from beyond. Hopefully you can remember more than a few fragments of this afterwards.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian7Desc;As the sacred steam fills your lungs
column2: your head swims with otherworldly visions. But these do not reveal useful secrets
column3: but horrifying and unsettling images. You scream
column4: clutching at the sides of the door
column5: trying to escape. Perhaps you will learn something from this
column7: it will be a high price to pay for knowledge.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian8Desc;As you prepare to enter the sacred sauna
column2: your Mentor stops you. They've heard of several rare ingredients that can enhance the sacred steam such that it is far more likely to yield success
column3: but it will cost money to find and gather these ingredients. They strongly advocate spending the time and money
column4: however
column5: claiming that your time will be spent much more fruitfully if you do.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB_nobelian8;You are just trying to get more money for yourself! How about you do the job I pay you for?;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian9Desc;The European continent was once the land of Nobel
column2: a land where men listened to his word and were enlightened by it. You have decided that you should go on a pilgrimage to the ancient sites of Europe
column3: hoping there to uncover some fragment of Ancient knowledge
column4: thought lost to time. But where shall you travel? Each region may yield different fruit.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_nobelian9;Scandinavia is the home of Nobel - let us search it.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: whose ships sailed every sea.;;;;;;;;;x
land of Franks and Germans.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian10Desc;The European continent was once the land of Nobel
column2: a land where men listened to his word and were enlightened by it. You have decided that you should go on a pilgrimage to the ancient sites of Europe
column3: hoping there to uncover some fragment of Ancient knowledge
column4: thought lost to time. But where shall you travel? Each region may yield different fruit.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: fierce and free.;;;;;;;;;x
beautiful but troubled.;;;;;;;;;x
I've changed my mind.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian11Desc;You have arrived safely and without event. As your small team of retainers and laborers disembarks from the ship
column2: you gaze into the horizon
column3: wondering what wonders await you.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian13Desc;As you disembark from your ship
column2: you notice a group of colorfully-robed officials coming by to accost you. Behind them stands a line of soldiers. It seems that the local lord of this place has demanded that you pay him tribute for the right of passing through his domain.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_nobelian13;Pay up - arguing isn't worth the trouble;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_nobelian13;Abandon the expedition and turn back home;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTD_nobelian13;Sneak past the guards and officials.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian14Desc;Disaster! A group of local bandits has surrounded your party and are demanding your money! The group looks ragged and poorly-trained
column2: but it is doubtful that a force as small as yours can resist them.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPA_nobelian14;Fight them off - they will scatter before a determined charge!;;;;;;;;;x

column2: but spare my life!;;;;;;;;;x
you think you're scary? I'll show YOU scary!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian15Desc;Disaster! While inspecting the remains of an Old World building
column2: your investigation team accidentally caused part of it to collapse! It will not be long before your entire team is buried under rubble!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB_nobelian15;Some quick thinking will save the day;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC_nobelian15;Go in there yourself and make sure everyone gets out safely!;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian17Desc;While travelling through this foreign country
column2: you have made contact with the many Nobelian minorities and communities throughtout it. Last night
column3: while staying at a small village
column4: you met a promising youth possessed of many skills and a desire to see the world. He is now asking you to take him with you on your expedition

column1: EVTOPTB_nobelian17;Another mouth to feed? I'd rather not bother.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian18Desc;You set out to write down your Mystical Experiences and lay them forth in an orderly manner. While they may be gratifying to you personally
column2: if they remain only within your own head
column3: they are unlikely to help anyone else.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_nobelian18;Now my memory is preserved in ink and paper.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian19Desc;You have begun the process of trying to reconstruct old texts and pieces of texts into readable and relevant works.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC_nobelian19;Try to recreate a Legendary Work;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian20Desc;Success! After countless dark hours spent considering
column2: meditating upon
column3: and recombining pieces of manuscript
column4: you have finally resurrected an Ancient book! Your name will be remembered forever as someone who brought great wisdom back to the world!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian21Desc;You have begun the painstaking process of experimenting with Old World recipes
column2: hoping against hope that you might be able to rediscover their secrets.;;;;;;;;;x
this is too hard for me.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian22Desc;The mist before your eyes clears
column2: as the mystical trance you were in dissipates. You gaze upon your work and
column3: for the first time
column4: truly realise what it is you have wrought. This is the formula for Peddler's Fire - the very weapon of the Merchant of Death! History would surely damn you forever if you were to re-introduce the world to this long-forgotten horror. And yet…you worked so hard on this... Surely all of this work cannot have been for naught?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB_nobelian22;I..I cannot! My name will be known
column2: even if it is cursed!;;;;;;;;;x
the burst of inspiration you were writing under disappears
column3: and you pause to examine your work. Your heart nearly leaps into your mouth. You have rediscovered the secret to an Ancient medicine! Your name will live forever!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian24Desc;You enter into a mystic trance
column2: and Nobel himself appears to you in a dream. He speaks to you of ancient wonders
column3: explaining completely a topic of art and science by which men may be edified and uplifted. He bids you swiftly to wake and inscribe it down
column4: before your memory fades. You are jarred awake and sit bolt upright
column5: practically jumping out of bed. Motes of the dream escape from your memory practically every second
column6: but you immediately write down as much of what you were told as you can remember. When it is done
column7: you have before you the text of a great revelation - a piece
column9: of the great truths known by Nobel.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian25Desc;The teaset you have assembled is dainty and beautiful. Tea is fairly hard to come by nowadays
column2: but regardless of whether or not you ever use it
column3: this item will surely make you the envy of many.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: you piece together the pieces of the arcane mechanism. Small sparks of electricity leap from its coils
column3: tingling and exciting you.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: DEATH_EXECUTION_SHOCKING;was crushed to death on the order of $KILLER$;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian27Desc;Your captor has decided to expose you to the judgment of the Tesla Coil. Pray that it spares you.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian28Desc;Your prisoner has been killed by the Tesla Coil!;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian29Desc;The Tesla Coil has wounded your prisoner
column2: but not killed them.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_nobelian.29;They have been judged worthy to live.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian30Desc;Your prisoner has escaped the judgment of the Tesla Coil!;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA_nobelian30;They have been judged worthy to live.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: against all odds
column3: not only escaped the judgment of the Tesla Coil
column4: but has in fact been blessed by it!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian32Desc;By combining many different fragments and analysing many different documents
column2: you have managed to recreate a famous Beer recipe from the Old World.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian33Desc;Through piecing together its fragmentary pieces
column2: you have managed to reconstitute an ancient text regarding the art of siege warfare. Though much of it is impossible to interpret
column3: it will still be of great use to you.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian_merge_insights_desc;Contemplate the knowledge you have gained
column2: and perhaps gain new ones.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian_repair_stuff_desc;Try to restore broken machinery to a functional state - or at least to doing something.;;;;;;;;;x
nobelian_merge_manuscript_fragments_desc;Recombine pieces of old lore into new knowledge - or better
column2: old knowledge.;;;;;;;;;x
the Nobelians have dreamt of rediscovering the secrets of the Ancient World. While it has been hundreds of years since the last true Laureate
column3: perhaps it is possible to do it after all...;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian_search_the_continent_desc;I should go on a great journey to the continent
column2: hoping to find something of value.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: nobelian_dive_occult_desc;The Nobelian faith has many great secrets
column2: many of which are concealed from the public eye. I should dive more deeply into these Mysteries
column3: hoping to discover something enlightening.;;;;;;;;;x
